name: Ext.ux.statusbar.StatusBar
doc:
Basic status bar component that can be used as the bottom toolbar of any Ext.Panel. In addition to supporting the standard Ext.toolbar.Toolbar interface for adding buttons, menus and other items, the StatusBar provides a greedy status element that can be aligned to either side and has convenient methods for setting the status text and icon. You can also indicate that something is processing using the showBusy method.

Ext.create('Ext.Panel', {
    title: 'StatusBar',
    // etc.
    bbar: Ext.create('Ext.ux.StatusBar', {
        id: 'my-status',

        // defaults to use when the status is cleared:
        defaultText: 'Default status text',
        defaultIconCls: 'default-icon',

        // values to set initially:
        text: 'Ready',
        iconCls: 'ready-icon',

        // any standard Toolbar items:
        items: [{
            text: 'A Button'
        }, '-', 'Plain Text']
    })
});

// Update the status bar later in code:
var sb = Ext.getCmp('my-status');
sb.setStatus({
    text: 'OK',
    iconCls: 'ok-icon',
    clear: true // auto-clear after a set interval
});

// Set the status bar to show that something is processing:
sb.showBusy();

// processing....

sb.clearStatus(); // once completeed

members.name: autoClear
members.doc: The number of milliseconds to wait after setting the status via setStatus before automatically clearing the status text and icon. Note that this only applies when passing the clear argument to setStatus since that is the only way to defer clearing the status. This can be overridden by specifying a different wait value in setStatus. Calls to clearStatus always clear the status bar immediately and ignore this value.
members.short_doc:
The number of milliseconds to wait after setting the status via
setStatus before automatically clearing the status te...

members.name: busyIconCls
members.doc: The default iconCls applied when calling showBusy. It can be overridden at any time by passing the iconCls argument into showBusy.
members.short_doc: The default iconCls applied when calling showBusy. ...

members.name: busyText
members.doc: The default text applied when calling showBusy. It can be overridden at any time by passing the text argument into showBusy.
members.short_doc: The default text applied when calling showBusy. ...

members.name: cls
members.doc: The base class applied to the containing element for this component on render.
members.short_doc: The base class applied to the containing element for this component on render. ...

members.name: defaultIconCls
members.doc: The default iconCls value (see the iconCls docs for additional details about customizing the icon). This will be used anytime the status bar is cleared with the useDefaults:true option.
members.short_doc:
The default iconCls value (see the iconCls docs for additional details about
customizing the icon). ...

members.name: defaultText
members.doc: The default text value. This will be used anytime the status bar is cleared with the useDefaults:true option.

members.name: emptyText
members.doc: The text string to use if no text has been set. If there are no other items in the toolbar using an empty string ('') for this value would end up in the toolbar height collapsing since the empty string will not maintain the toolbar height. Use '' if the toolbar should collapse in height vertically when no text is specified and there are no other items in the toolbar.
members.short_doc: The text string to use if no text has been set. ...

members.name: iconCls
members.localdoc:
Note: This CSS class will be initially set as the status bar icon. See also defaultIconCls and busyIconCls.

Example usage:

// Example CSS rule:
.x-statusbar .x-status-custom {
    padding-left: 25px;
    background: transparent url(images/custom-icon.gif) no-repeat 3px 2px;
}

// Setting a default icon:
var sb = Ext.create('Ext.ux.statusbar.StatusBar', {
    defaultIconCls: 'x-status-custom'
});

// Changing the icon:
sb.setStatus({
    text: 'New status',
    iconCls: 'x-status-custom'
});

members.name: statusAlign
members.doc:
The alignment of the status element within the overall StatusBar layout. When the StatusBar is rendered, it creates an internal div containing the status text and icon. Any additional Toolbar items added in the StatusBar's items config, or added via add or any of the supported add* methods, will be rendered, in added order, to the opposite side. The status element is greedy, so it will automatically expand to take up all sapce left over by any other items. Example usage:

// Create a left-aligned status bar containing a button,
// separator and text item that will be right-aligned (default):
Ext.create('Ext.Panel', {
    title: 'StatusBar',
    // etc.
    bbar: Ext.create('Ext.ux.statusbar.StatusBar', {
        defaultText: 'Default status text',
        id: 'status-id',
        items: [{
            text: 'A Button'
        }, '-', 'Plain Text']
    })
});

// By adding the statusAlign config, this will create the
// exact same toolbar, except the status and toolbar item
// layout will be reversed from the previous example:
Ext.create('Ext.Panel', {
    title: 'StatusBar',
    // etc.
    bbar: Ext.create('Ext.ux.statusbar.StatusBar', {
        defaultText: 'Default status text',
        id: 'status-id',
        statusAlign: 'right',
        items: [{
            text: 'A Button'
        }, '-', 'Plain Text']
    })
});
members.short_doc: The alignment of the status element within the overall StatusBar layout. ...

members.name: text
members.doc: A string that will be initially set as the status message. This string will be set as innerHTML (html tags are accepted) for the toolbar item. If not specified, the value set for defaultText will be used.
members.short_doc: A string that will be initially set as the status message. ...

members.name: clearStatus
members.doc: Clears the status text and iconCls. Also supports clearing via an optional fade out animation.

params.name: config
params.doc: A config object containing any or all of the following properties. If this object is not specified the status will be cleared using the defaults below:

properties.name: anim
properties.doc: True to clear the status by fading out the status element (defaults to false which clears immediately).

properties.name: useDefaults
properties.doc: True to reset the text and icon using defaultText and defaultIconCls (defaults to false which sets the text to '' and removes any existing icon class).

members.short_doc: Clears the status text and iconCls. ...

members.name: setIcon
members.doc: Convenience method for setting the status icon directly. For more flexible options see setStatus. See iconCls for complete details about customizing the icon.

params.name: cls
params.doc: The icon class to set (defaults to '', and any current icon class is removed)

members.short_doc: Convenience method for setting the status icon directly. ...

members.name: setStatus
members.doc:
Sets the status text and/or iconCls. Also supports automatically clearing the status that was set after a specified interval.

Example usage:

// Simple call to update the text
statusBar.setStatus('New status');

// Set the status and icon, auto-clearing with default options:
statusBar.setStatus({
    text: 'New status',
    iconCls: 'x-status-custom',
    clear: true
});

// Auto-clear with custom options:
statusBar.setStatus({
    text: 'New status',
    iconCls: 'x-status-custom',
    clear: {
        wait: 8000,
        anim: false,
        useDefaults: false
    }
});

params.name: config
params.doc: A config object specifying what status to set, or a string assumed to be the status text (and all other options are defaulted as explained below). A config object containing any or all of the following properties can be passed:

properties.name: text
properties.doc: The status text to display. If not specified, any current status text will remain unchanged.

properties.name: iconCls
properties.doc: The CSS class used to customize the status icon (see iconCls for details). If not specified, any current iconCls will remain unchanged.

properties.name: clear
properties.doc: Allows you to set an internal callback that will automatically clear the status text and iconCls after a specified amount of time has passed. If clear is not specified, the new status will not be auto-cleared and will stay until updated again or cleared using clearStatus. If true is passed, the status will be cleared using autoClear, defaultText and defaultIconCls via a fade out animation. If a numeric value is passed, it will be used as the callback interval (in milliseconds), overriding the autoClear value. All other options will be defaulted as with the boolean option. To customize any other options, you can pass an object in the format:

properties.name: wait
properties.doc: The number of milliseconds to wait before clearing (defaults to autoClear).

properties.name: anim
properties.doc: False to clear the status immediately once the callback executes (defaults to true which fades the status out).

properties.name: useDefaults
properties.doc: False to completely clear the status text and iconCls (defaults to true which uses defaultText and defaultIconCls).

members.short_doc: Sets the status text and/or iconCls. ...

members.name: setText
members.doc: Convenience method for setting the status text directly. For more flexible options see setStatus.
members.short_doc: Convenience method for setting the status text directly. ...

members.name: showBusy
members.doc: Convenience method for setting the status text and icon to special values that are pre-configured to indicate a "busy" state, usually for loading or processing activities.

params.name: config
params.doc: A config object in the same format supported by setStatus, or a string to use as the status text (in which case all other options for setStatus will be defaulted). Use the text and/or iconCls properties on the config to override the default busyText and busyIconCls settings. If the config argument is not specified, busyText and busyIconCls will be used in conjunction with all of the default options for setStatus.

members.short_doc:
Convenience method for setting the status text and icon to special values that are
pre-configured to indicate a "busy...
